RainbruRPG::Core::vcConstant

RainbruRPG::Core::vcConstant Class Reference

#include <vcconstant.h>

Collaboration diagram for RainbruRPG::Core::vcConstant:

List of all members.

Detailed Description

A very simple constant velocity calculator.

It uses translationLenght and transitionTime to give the velocity value for each frame. It attemps to give a constant velocity according to the time of the last given lenght. According to the time elapsed between two calls, getNextFrame(bool&) give a lenght.

A Ogre timer object (defined in VelocityCalculator) is used for time calculation.

See also:
VelocityCalculator

Member Function Documentation

float RainbruRPG::Core::vcConstant::getNextFrame ( bool &  b  )  [virtual]

Get the next frame.

It returns the translation lenght since the last call. You must pass a boolean by reference as parameter for b because it may be modified. It will be set to false if the translation is ended.

Parameters:
b The boolean that will be set to false if the transation is ended
Returns:
The translation value since the last call of this function

Implements RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator.

Definition at line 50 of file vcconstant.cpp.

float RainbruRPG::Core::vcConstant::getLenghtByTime ( double  d  )  [private]

Get the lenght made at this TimeLine.

This function is called by getNextFrame(bool&). It returns the lenght the translation may made for the given time elapsed.

Parameters:
d the time of a frame
Returns:
The transition theorically made for the given time

Definition at line 83 of file vcconstant.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator::setTranslationLenght ( float  f  )  [inherited]

Sets the total lenght of translation.

OpenGL uses often a translation factor in screen size (1.0 is the half screen).

It sends a warning log if the given parameter is equal to 0.

Parameters:
f The new translation lenght

Definition at line 92 of file velocitycalculator.cpp.

void RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator::setTransitionTime ( unsigned int  i  )  [inherited]

Sets the transition time.

See the subclass documentation you are using to know if it uses milliseconds or microseconds as the Ogre timer handles both times.

It sends a warning log if the given parameter is equal to 0.

Parameters:
i The new transition time

Member Data Documentation

unsigned long RainbruRPG::Core::VelocityCalculator::lastFrameTimeLine [protected, inherited]

The time get from the Ogre timer for the last frame.

It can be in milliseconds or microseconds according to what you use. Its default value is 0.
